title: My little brother got scammed
body:
As the title says, my little brother clicked on a link given to him by a complete stranger and 'logged in' into league of legens for free RP
Well, he didnt get rp and started playing a game. 
After that game he got told that someone logged into his account from a different computer. 
His password and e-mail got changed, so I send Riot a ticket. I explained what happened and gave them proof that account was my brothers one
( Next day someone played Draven on his account ) , he doesnt even have Draven .-.

So my question is, Would Riot be able to help me get his account back?

replies.body:
Possibly, he'd have to send in a support ticket and work with the account specialist to get his account back. However in the end your brother is ultimately responsible for his account. He really should have known better then to trust a complete stranger with his account information. This might be a harsh lesson he needs.

Regardless, tell him to send in a support ticket and be prepared to answer some security questions that the account specialist will ask him. If he can;t answer the questions well enough then there will be no hope for his account and he;ll have to start over.

Good luck.

Gonna be hard if they also changed his e-mail.
Open a ticket and hope for the best.
Also, LOL? These scams actually work on some people?!

Riot should have more safeguards like 2-step authentication and stricter email/password verification from the registered email address.

"Don't take candy from strangers."
